III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
Jackson House is the new name and location of Kevin Moody Youth Home.
Jackson House is an updated home that was previously used as hospital housing.
Kevin Moody will move to Jackson House once the facility is licensed. Jackson
2

House has been turned into a duplex with Suite 1 housing the CCI and Suite 2
housing young adults. The entrance to Suite 1 is at the back of the home. Suite 2
has a separate entrance at the front of the home. The way the home is set up will
not allow for youth in Suite 1 to mix with the young adults in Suite 2.
Upon entering Suite 1 is a staff desk and a long hallway. Off the long hallway are
five bedrooms, an enclosed stairwell, a closet, a furnace room, and elevator. The
first of the five bedrooms is a large room that is set up to house a parenting youth.
This room can also be set up to house 2 youth. All other bedrooms are set up for
two youth with beds and storage for belongings. Each bedroom has its own
bathroom and windows to the outside. All beds have appropriate bedding.
The enclosed stairway located in the long hallway leads down to the lower level or
up to the second floor. The door at the top of the stairs leading to the second floor
is locked so it cannot be accessed by the youth. The second floor is only utilized
by the young adults who have a separate stairway they will use to access the 2nd
floor. The second stairway is located in Suite 2 and cannot be accessed by the
youth. The lower level can be accessed by youth and houses offices, a
recreations room, storage rooms, laundry, a meeting room, bathroom, and the
kitchen. The kitchen is well equipped with duplicate appliances and plenty of
space for all 10 youth to eat in the dining area within the kitchen.
The elevator located in the long hallway with the bedrooms is only accessed by
key. The elevator is only to be utilized with a staff member who will ensure the
youth and adults do not mix.
The facility is protected by an alarm and video surveillance. It is clean, well-
organized, and appropriately equipped to house 10 youth.
B. Program Description
The Jackson House is a program of Gateway Youth Services through Child &
Family Charities. It will be set up the same as the current Kevin Moody Youth
Home which is comprised of two programs under the CCI license.
The Higher Ground program is designed for youth who are in crisis and in need of
immediate shelter. This program is set up for helping youth work toward
reunification with their families. This is considered a short-term (21-day) stay. This
program serves coed youth ages 12-17. Youth in this program receive group,
individual, and family therapy, food, clothing, life skills, social/communication
skills, job skills and budgeting skills development. Other services include family
mediation, future planning, education, tutoring, transportation, support and
guidance. Youth in this program attend the education program they attended
before entering the shelter.
3

For youth who need shelter and supervision in order to work toward
independence the facility provides the Crossroads program which is typically a
longer stay. Crossroads Transitional Living Program serves youth ages 16 and 17
who are without safe, stable, permanent housing. The youth work closely with
case management staff to develop independence and self-sufficiency. This
program provides transportation, housing, basic needs items, food, health and
mental health care, education, employment and financial skills.
Both programs provide one awake fully trained staff for every 10 youth.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
A six-month original license is recommended. The facility will comply with its current
corrective action plans as noted within license CI230369658.
